Items.Title: ECHO Daily Map of 15 January 2024
Items.Sources: GDACS, Meteo France La Reunion, ECMWF, HWRF, JRC GHSL

EchoFlash.Title: Reunion - Tropical Cyclone BELAL
EchoFlash.Description:
• Tropical Cyclone BELAL, formed in the southwestern Indian Ocean, is moving south-southeast and is expected to make landfall over Reunion on 15 January. After that, it will continue eastwards and approach Mauritius on 16 January.
  • On 14 January at 6.00 UTC, its centre was located approximately 280 km northwest of Reunion with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/h. BELAL will intensify in the next 24 hours to the stage of an intense tropical cyclone (Cat 3 or 4) upon reaching Reunion Island.
  • According to Meteo France, even if BELAL passes close to the north Reunion coast without making landfall, winds reaching 200 km/h will affect the island.  Heavy rainfall of 200 to 400 mm over 24 hours and storm surge of 50 cm or more is also expected. Waves in excess of 4 metres are forecast from Sunday evening, rising to over 6 metres on Monday.
  • Mauritius will be affected by the same conditions by Monday evening.

Emergencies.Title: Israel - Conflict - October 2023
Emergencies.PublicDescription: Following the hostilities taking place in Israel and Palestine, Belgium has activated the EU Civil Protection Mechanism to streamline the coordination of repatriation flights to Europe.

Items.Title: Sudan – Conflict and population displacement since 15 April 2023
Items.Description: Updated map of the conflict in Sudan: clashes, internal displacements post-conflict per State, cross-border movements, total internally displaced persons, total cross-border movements and EHRC operations.

Request.Title: Sudan Conflict and population displacement since 15 April 2023
Request.Description:
UPDATE OF CRISIS REPORT N9

Attached the crisis report N9 with the similar map to update. For the IDPs data, please use the data provided by IOM in the weekly displacement snapshot 15 available at https://dtm.iom.int/reports/dtm-sudan-weekly-displacement-snapshot-15

In this source, please use the information for the overall refugees and IDPs in the neighboring countries provided in the map at page 1.

For the IDPS within Sudan, use the data of colum 1 in the table page 2, called "snapshot 15 - 2 Jan 24".

For the conflict hotspots and arrows, please use the OCHA map available at https://reliefweb.int/report/sudan/sudan-humanitarian-update-4-january-2024-enar 

The information of Humanitarian flights remain the same as Crisis Report 9.
Request.FileName: ECHO Crisis Report no.9 - Sudan Crisis.pdf

Items.Title: ECHO Daily Map of 10 January 2024
Items.Description: Western Europe | Severe weather and EU response

Emergencies.Title: Germany - Flood - December 2023
Emergencies.PublicDescription:
Since 18-Dec-23 Germany is experiencing continuous flooding in the northern half of the country, mainly in the Federal States of Lower Saxony and Thuringia.

At around 40 gauges in Lower Saxony water levels above 2/4 are measured. As the water level have risen since 18-Dec-23, several of the already softened dikes have reached their capacity and are in danger of bursting. According to the Copernicus assessment around 21,750 people may be affected.

Emergencies.Title: France - Flood - January 2024
Emergencies.PublicDescription: France is being affected by serious floods in north of the country (Nord and Pas de Calais districts). France requests 3 or 4 high capacity pumps (total capacity of 18 000 m³/h) through the Union Civil Protection Mechanims.

Items.Sources: Copernicus EMSR, JRC GLOFAS GFM, JRC EFAS, NASA MODIS, DG ECHO, JRC GHSL, COGIC

EchoFlash.Title: France - Severe weather
EchoFlash.Description:
• On 8-9 January, heavy snowfall and low temperatures have affected the 
    Île-de-France and Lower Normandy, northern-central France causing severe weather-related incidents and resulting in casualties and traffic disruptions.
  • According to the Operational Center for Crisis Management (COGIC), three people have been seriously injured and 49 others reported minor injuries following severe weather-related incidents. Traffic disruptions have been recorded, and around 1,000 vehicles have been blocked on the roads.
  • On 10 January, moderate rain with localised freezing rain is forecast across southern and south-eastern France while on 11 January, no precipitations and low temperatures are expected across the country.
EchoFlash.DescriptionJRC:
• On 8-9 January, heavy snowfall and low temperatures have affected the 
    Île-de-France and Lower Normandy (northern-central France) causing severe weather-related incidents and resulting in casualties and traffic disruptions.
  • According to the Operational Center for Crisis Management (COGIC), three people have been seriously injured and 49 others reported minor injuries following severe weather-related incidents. Traffic disruptions have been recorded, and around 1,000 vehicles have been blocked on the roads.
  • On 10 January, moderate rain with localized freezing rain is forecast across southern and south-eastern France while on 11 January, no precipitations and low temperatures are expected across the country.
